result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Wendt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael R Wendt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael R Wendt was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Transfer of probation authorized to Sauk Co.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.
Psychological counseling. Take all medication as prescribed. Participate in cognitive thinking course. Write letter of apology to officer within 30 days. Provide to agent to provide to officer.

timeConds.notes: Stayed for satisfaction of probation conditions particularly the letter & psychological treatment. If def is in compliance for 1 yr, permanently stayed.

SIGNATURE BOND SET - REFERRAL TO BMP
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  
- If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500 (per case), cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Trial Judge - Br 11

Defense requests signature bond. Objection from State. Court orders signature bond to revert to cash for non-compliance and referral to bail monitoring. All other conditions the same. Defn is to follow recommendations from psychiatrist or mental health professional.
